FIELD REPORT 7-X
CLASSIFICATION: TOP SECRET

FROM: Dr. Elena Vasquez

Orbital deviation now visible
to civilian astronomers.
Cover story approved:
"Solar minimum event."

Energy loss: 0.4%/yr,
compounding.

FIELD TECHNICIAN LOG
Relay Station B-7

Subterranean array hums
differently now. Pitch
dropped maybe two tones
since last month.

Thermal anchor prototypes
holding at 4C above ambient.
Small mercy.

[REDACTED] COMMITTEE EXCERPT

Node cascade risk elevated
to CATEGORY 3.

Stabilization infrastructure
must be expanded underground.
Surface installations are
no longer viable beyond
phase 2 projections.

VASQUEZ ADDENDUM:

The underground relays are
our only realistic option.

I've started calling them
"geothermal stabilization
nodes." The committee prefers
"thermal anchors."

I don't care what we call
them. They need to work.

ADDENDUM (CLASSIFIED):

Separately, Engineering has
proposed a deep-band relay
network. Seven satellites in
high orbit, listening for a
specific frequency.

They're calling it
"Project Lighthouse."

The idea is simple: if
someone survives long enough
to build a transponder,
the satellites relay the
signal to Mars.

I approved the funding.
The committee doesn't know.
